text:
Tap the brewery.

A: Semi clear, red color. Thin creme head.

N: Grapefruit, pine, cracker, rye, peppercorn, esters, leaves and bracken, some toffee, sourdough and orange peel.

T: Quite bitter, not much sweetness, and a touch spicey.

M: Light body, slightly resinous, some alcohol, spritzy carbonation.

O: Zest beer. Looking for something else in my lager though. A clearly defined path to greatness, if you will.
(En fût à la source): Pain caramélisé, des agrumes moyennement sucrées et une bonne amertume fruitée.

On tap at the brewpub in White Salmon. 

The light amber body has good clarity and is topped by a durable beige head that leaves exceptional lacing. 
 Mildly bitter although hop dominated. 
Medium-light body is smooth with medium-light carbonation
Collective on Tap, Woodinville. Woody orange, stringy small foam. Clean sip, warms through. Banana bread, good bittering body. Pretty nice. Touch juice up front. Pretty nice!

Pours a finger of head on a clear medium straw body.
The aroma is mild grain.
The taste is a nice dry grain with a mild bitter middle.
The texture is crisp with a medium body.
Its nice and easy.

Tap at Everybodys Brewing, White Salmon, 24/05/13.
Clear golden with a thin off white head, good lacing ensues.
Nose is pale malt, light citrus zest, orange, hops.
Taste comprises bitter hop notes, orange pith, grass.
Medium bodied, soft carbonation, bitterness in the finish.
Ok stuff - clean and refreshing.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Sample at the Tap House Grill in Seattle. This brew pours a clear pale amber color with a medium off-white head that dissipates steadily. Stringy lacing on the glass. Aroma of hops, herbs and grain. Light-bodied with flavors of herbal hops, toasted malt and a touch of fruit. The finish is mildly bitter with a hoppy aftertaste. Decent overall.
On tap Hazy orange with a small white head. Scent is fruity and hoppy. Taste is citrus.

draft at Cheese Bar. 
dried peach American hops.
toasty crunchy bread crust malt.
assertive bitterness.
medium-dry.
pithy dried orange.
brash hop acids.
Clear amber color with lasting tan head. Nice light berry fruit, pale malt aromas. medium bodied. Grainy pale malt, bready, yeasty flavors with some light berry fruit sweetness--not bad.
user_location: Same Trailer, Different Park, Louisiana, USA

text: From tap at Taphouse Grill. Pours cloudy orange with a small white head. Aroma is mild fruity and crisp hoppy. Light bitter and grapefruity. Smooth hoppy and medium dry into the finish.

Light amber, clear. Good head retention and clarity. Aroma is biscuit, wild herbs, lavender. Flavor is soft, layered caramel, pressed flowery hops. Finish is mildly spicy, musty soda crackers, light sweetness. Very good balance, tasty beer.
At Mickey Finns. Better than the food at Mickey Finns, but then what isnt? Hoppy than expected. Pretty average beer.
Orange/gold,lasting beige head.Piney hop nose.Big citrus piney hop profile, big malt backbone, Full bodied with great lacing

Amber body with thin head that stretches to cover it. A bit fruity with more floral hop character than any common ale/steam beer that I can recollect. Nice easy leafiness and an enjoyable bitter leaf flavor. In fact, to me, this is more reminiscent of an ESB, and a solid, sessionable one at that. Twangy finish that is fairly bitter sour and a bit offkey--perhaps from rye malt.
Nowhere close to Anchor Steam in style.  A departure from the common.  sharp and vegetal.  a lot of floral notes.  not very hoppy or malty. thumbs down.

4 oz. taster @ Portland, Oregon Spring Beer & Wine Fest April 3rd, 2010.  5.5% ABV.  65 IBUs.  Cloudy bright gold color.  Rich herbal front.  Crusty creamy malty mild fruit body.  Clean mild citrus hop end.  Hoppy zesty brew.

Tap @ Baileys Taproom...  Poured hazy, amber/orange with an off-white head.  Lightly hopped aroma lending towards a citrus nose.  A clean brew all around.  Noticeable malts and an earth, citrus hop flavor for a bitter balance to the sweet tones.  The Common Ale comes off nicely with an extra hop bite.

On tap at Mickey Finns. Hoppier than expected. Aroma a little laid back, maty with some hop edge. Light amber with minimal head (not a lot of head at this bar in general.) More hops than I expected, good carbonation, well-balanced, that lighter lager feel.
